file_content.text: You've returned. Tell me you were able to deposit the poisoned body parts throughout the Colicoid nest?
I had to fight off swarm after swarm, but finally pulled it off.
Yes. It was difficult.
The Colicoids are surprisingly powerful, but I managed.
Yes. It was difficult.
It took a much greater effort than expected, but the deed is done.
Yes. It was difficult.
Quite a gruesome task, but it is indeed complete.
Yes. It was difficult.
Never in question.
I'm done doing you favors.
If the Colicoids associate eating human flesh with dying, their survival instinct will steer them away from us as a food source.
Wow, those body parts sure are ripe. You should head to Bugtown before they completely spoil.
These are grim days, friend. I am Captain Renzfeil Neuwt, Imperial Command. Your presence here couldn't come at a better time.
Please, try to overlook the stench of death upon me. Sometimes the work we do to preserve the Empire is dirty.
Dirty work is my specialty.
You're speaking my language.
Yes, perhaps the horrors I've seen and been forced to do are nothing to you.
You don't have to tell me.
True.
No doubt what has befallen me is benign compared to some of what you have seen.
Don't apologize for dealing death, Imperial.
Be proud.
I'm disturbed to say the blood on my hands is not enemy blood, my lord.
Killing is neither dirty nor clean, simply necessary.
That's nonsense.
Sadly, the blood on my hands is not the enemy's, my lord.
Explain.
Maybe you should take a shower.
Then clean yourself.
I'm afraid what has bloodied me is more than skin deep.
There's a terrible scourge terrorizing this world--the Colicoids. Savage, genetically enhanced creatures with a ravenous taste for human flesh.
Emboldened by hunger, the Colicoids are encroaching on settled areas and Imperial holdings. Many of the Empire's finest have become food for these bugs.
Tell me what you want me to do.
What's the solution?
You said they were "genetically engineered." Where do they come from?
What are the Colicoids?
Wartime experiments by the Balmorrans. No one who knows the details is still alive.
Then they weren't the Empire's finest, were they?
Only a failure falls to a bug.
Believe me, we have lost a lot of good men. They deserve to be avenged.
I've developed a poison that kills the Colicoids when consumed. I've collected bodies of the fallen and treated them with the toxin.
Then I had to... cut the poisoned bodies into pieces. Now they must be dispersed around the bugs' nests. Will you do this?
A Sith is not squeamish about such things.
Won't bother me at all.
Dead bodies don't disturb me. I'm only affected by the living.
Won't bother me at all.
If the Empire's interests will be served, I'm ready for anything.
Not a problem.
I'm not squeamish about the jobs I do, as long as I'm paid.
Credits are credits.
I see, of course, you're a hired gun. Yes, you will be compensated. Please, just find your way to Bugtown in Broken Valley.
So we kill a few dozen bugs--big deal.
How will that do enough?
Except that, I believe once the Colicoids start to associate eating human flesh with dying, they'll lose their taste for it.
If the bugs no longer savor humans, the infestation will not spread toward our settlements and outposts.
Believe me, this is not simply one man's pathetic revenge. Please, will you take up this charge?
I'm convinced.
I suppose.
I'm relieved. You'll have to make the trek to Bugtown in Broken Valley--the site of the experiments that made the bugs.
Here... a bag of the poisoned body parts. Tread cautiously, it will attract the creatures in droves.
Find the Colicoid feasting mounds around the area and deposit body parts on each mound. I hope you return to me in one piece.
Have to pass. [Refuse quest]
It's not for me. [Refuse quest]
Well, that's disappointing. I'm not sure how long I can keep these body parts from spoiling. The Colicoids prefer fresh meat.
If you change your mind, please do it soon and find me again.
I'm a bit busy, but... we should talk later.
However... in studying the Colicoids I've discovered a strange sonic pulse being broadcast by the Republic that seems to ward off the hideous bugs.
I brought this to the attention of Commander Geates; he was none too pleased.
Tell me about this Commander Geates.
Who?
I'll do one better than that. I'll patch him in on my holo. He's going to want to speak with you, I'm sure.
Why was he so upset?
Explain.
Let me patch him through my holo. He can explain things much better than I can.
So what?
You're right, I'm not doing this justice. Let me hail the commander--
Captain Neuwt, this better be important. Have you found someone capable of taking on my mission?
Never mind, I can see for myself. Yes, more than capable by the look of it.
I'll just be standing by. In case you... need me.
All right, enough wheel spinning. Will you do it or not?
You would be wise to adjust your tone, Imperial.
Mind yourself.
I don't even tolerate my master speaking to me this way, Imperial.
Mind yourself.
All right. There's no time for bickering, so I'll lighten my touch.
If it pays, I'll probably do just about anything.
Money talks.
You'll get compensated. I have a discretionary fund I can dip into, and this operation is more than worth it.
Intelligence is always sorting out the military's affairs.
Typical incompetence.
We both have backs that need scratching, agent.
I'm ready to serve, but I'll need the details of the operation, Commander.
More than likely.
Depends on what "it" is.
I don't know.
I take it Captain Neuwt didn't brief you. I have to do everything.
The Republic has a sonic pulse that repels the Colicoids; I want it for our side.
I need you to dismantle the Republic relay stations, bring me their technology, and destroy their control center.
Good idea.
Just let me get going.
After you've completed the mission, bring the parts to me at the command center on the front. Geates out.
No. [Refuse quest]
I'm not used to being rejected. You'd be wise to change your mind. Have Captain Neuwt call me if you do. Geates out.
Commander Geates is waiting for you to deliver the sonic repulsion parts to him at his command center.
